intro: Pseudocalymma alliaceum var. microcalyx, commonly known as the small-flowered flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically greenish or brownish in color. It thrives in wet or seasonally wet environments, often found in swampy or waterlogged soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
